intro: Nothopegia colebrookeana, commonly known as the Ceylon evergreen, is a flowering plant native to Sri Lanka. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its evergreen nature and dense foliage. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a glossy appearance. The flowers are small, clustered, and often white or pale yellow, contributing to its ornamental value.
